Summary: Author's Summary:Four years on from his brutal escape, Dick Grayson has managed to carve out a simple, if a little lonely, life for himself – that is until he meets the imposing but kind hearted “successful businessman” Jason Todd.Four years on from the incident at the Court of Owls, Batman finally has a lead and wrangles Red Hood’s help to track down the last remaining Talon. It’s a case that Jason isn’t awfully concerned about until traces of the Talon keep popping up around his sweet but naïve new boyfriend Dick – a man he would do anything to protect.

entry.title: the ghosts we leave behind
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,004Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 152

Summary: She had died in that suit. Bled in those colors. Burned for the symbol on her chest. And in less than six months Bruce had handed her place to someone else. Not another lost kid who knew the streets, who knew hunger and rage like she did. No. He’d chosen a boy. A boy with wealth, with schooling, with doors that had always been open to him. A boy who fit into Bruce’s world so easily, so seamlessly, while she had scraped and clawed for every scrap of approval. Everything she had never been good enough for—Tim Drake was, by default. The memory still cut. It always would. Because the Joker had lived. Because she had died. And because Bruce had moved on. Her lips curved into a smile, though there was nothing kind about it, her eyes glittering with something brittle. “So you’re the one,” she said softly, bitterly. “My replacement.”Jane Todd came back to Gotham with a bang—or more accurately, the Joker’s head mounted on Arkham’s gates. It was only the beginning of the chaos she intended to bring.

entry.title: fish hook
entry.summary:
Author: prideinmymouth

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,912Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 42

Summary: In these moment, it's easier for Jason to pretend he's Tim than it is to pretend he and Dick are actually family. Jason never got the train surfing or movie nights or phone calls—or the million other things that Tim talks about on those rare occasions when Jason can get him to loosen up and drink with him. All Jason got was a number scrawled on a slip of paper like an afterthought and an assurance that only one of them knew was a lie. It was the same empty promise that he got from every adult growing up, and Jason had learnt not to call long before he met Dick Grayson.orif jason can't have what he wants, neither can tim. entry.title: Null Signature
entry.summary:
Author: AiKotoba

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 144,447Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 110

Summary: Dick Grayson has seen monsters before. He just never expected to recognize one. The pit is Gotham’s best-kept secret—an underground arena where bio-engineered beasts fight to the death, and the crowds cheer louder for blood than justice. But it’s not the monsters that pull him in. It’s the man behind one of them. Red Hood doesn’t speak much. Doesn’t take off the helmet. Doesn’t miss. He baits the deadliest creature in the ring like it’s an extension of himself—and maybe it is. Dick was only supposed to observe. Now he can’t look away. Because Wrathnir fights like someone who’s trained. Red Hood watches like someone who’s remembering. And Dick’s starting to think the thing in the cage isn’t the only ghost down here.
